description.narrative: he Movimiento Sin Tierra de Cochabamba will provide families with comprehensive information around agrarian issues, small farms, and the complexity of low lands, all of which to help them attain a just and dignified livelihood. The current situation of landless and smallholding (insufficient lands) families is very uncertain and has the potential to translate into endemic poverty. There are few options for these families, so the group is working to unify them and support their basic human rights – which include access to land. With climate change and the minimal agricultural productiveness of the land, families and youth are facing low income and are forced migrate to urban centers and slums. The group will help landless families organize, develop trainings and events in Cochabamba, initiate activities around land rights and access in rural settlements, promote alliances with other indigenous communities in the lowlands, and organize activities that identify public lands.
